documentation.text:
NOTE: Whenever modifying the storage layout here it is important to update the validateStorageLayout
 function in its respective mock contract to ensure that it doesn't break anything or lead to unexpected
 behaviors/layout when upgrading

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract IERC20,uint8,enum ISuperTokenFactory.Upgradability,string calldata,string calldata) returns (contract ISuperToken)

params.token: Newly created custom super token address

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

computeCanonicalERC20WrapperAddress(addr.details: We return from our canonical list if it already exists, otherwise we compute itnote that this function only computes addresses for SEMI_UPGRADABLE SuperTokens

returns.isDeployed: whether the super token is deployed AND set in the canonical mapping

createCanonicalERC20Wrapper(address).details: salt for create2 is the keccak256 hash of abi.encode(address(_underlyingToken))

returns.superToken: The deployed and initialized wrapper super token NOTE: - It assumes token provide the .decimals() function
The deployed and initialized wrapper super token

getCanonicalERC20Wrapper(address).details: We return the address if it exists and the zero address otherwise

initializeCanonicalWrapperSuperTokens((a.details: Note that this should also be kind of a throwaway function which will be executed only once.

params._data: an array of canonical wrappper super tokens to be set

initializeCustomSuperToken(address).details: Creates a new custom super token

params.customSuperTokenProxy: address of the custom supertoken proxy

proxiableUUID().details: Proxiable UUID marker function, this would help to avoid wrong logic      contract to be used for upgrading. NOTE: The semantics of the UUID deviates from the actual UUPS standard,       where it is equivalent of _IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT.

updateCode(address).details: This function updates the logic contract for the SuperTokenFactory

params.newAddress: the new address of the SuperTokenFactory logic contract

_canonicalWrapperSuperTokens.details: Reasoning: (1) provide backwards compatibility for existing listed wrapper super tokens(2) prevent address retrieval issues if we ever choose to modify the bytecode of the UUPSProxy contractNOTE: address(0) key points to the NativeAssetSuperToken on the network.

SUPER_TOKEN_FACTORY_ONLY_GOVERNANCE_OWNE.notice: NOTE: Whenever modifying the storage layout here it is important to update the validateStorageLayout function in its respective mock contract to ensure that it doesn't break anything or lead to unexpected behaviors/layout when upgrading

computeCanonicalERC20WrapperAddress(addr.notice: Computes/Retrieves wrapper super token address given the underlying token address

createCanonicalERC20Wrapper(address).notice: Creates a wrapper super token AND sets it in the canonical list OR reverts if it already exists

createERC20Wrapper(address,uint8,string,.notice: Create new super token wrapper for the underlying ERC20 token with extra token info

createERC20Wrapper(address,uint8,uint8,s.notice: Create new super token wrapper for the underlying ERC20 token

getCanonicalERC20Wrapper(address).notice: Gets the canonical ERC20 wrapper super token address given the underlying token address

getSuperTokenLogic().notice: Get the canonical super token logic.

initializeCanonicalWrapperSuperTokens((a.notice: Initializes list of canonical wrapper super tokens.

updateCode(address).notice: Updates the logic contract for the SuperTokenFactory
